JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a private NORP broadcasting company ( “ the applicant company ” ) that was set up in DATE and has its registered office in GPE . The applicant company was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON , ORG and PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE , Mr PERSON and Ms PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE , and PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the applicant company established the ACARDINAL + television company within its structure , with the intention of getting involved in television broadcasting .

On DATE , in preparation for broadcasting , the applicant company opened a school to train personnel , such as journalists , cameramen and technicians who were later employed by the applicant company .

On DATE the applicant company started television broadcasting through its ACARDINAL + channel , first sharing capacity and content with GPE “ REN ” TV , a NORP television company . Over time , the volume of the content produced by the applicant company increased significantly .

On DATE the applicant company was granted a license by the then ORG ( ՀՀ կապի նախարարություն ) permitting it to install a television transmitter in GPE and to broadcast within the decimetric wave band . The license was granted for a period of DATE .
In DATE the applicant company established “ PERSON , a network of CARDINAL private licensed regional television companies , broadcasting TIME a day .

The content of the CARDINAL + television channel included international and domestic news analysis ( PERCENT ) , advertising ( PERCENT ) and various entertainment programmes . The applicant company submitted that the ACARDINAL + television channel was widely recognised as one of the few independent voices in television broadcasting in GPE .
In DATE legislative changes were introduced in the sphere of television and radio broadcasting .

ORG ( « Հեռուստատեսության և ռադիոյի մասին ORG օրենք – “ the LAW ” ) , passed in DATE , established a new authority , ORG ( Հեռուստատեսության և ռադիոյի ազգային հանձնաժողով – “ the ORG ” ) , which was entrusted with regulating the licensing and monitoring the activities of private television and radio companies . The ORG was a public body composed of CARDINAL members appointed by the President of GPE . LAW also introduced a new licensing procedure , according to which a broadcasting license was granted on the basis of a call for tenders conducted by the ORG in respect of the list of available frequencies .
During DATE all existing broadcasting licenses were temporarily re - registered by the ORG until the relevant calls for tenders were announced .
On DATE the ORG replaced the applicant company 's license with a new license . The new license was granted for band CARDINAL and was due to expire on DATE .

On DATE the ORG decided to postpone the call for tenders for band CARDINAL until the adoption of appropriate rules and regulations and to permit the applicant company to continue to operate in band CARDINAL for an indefinite period of time until such call for tenders was put out .
On DATE the ORG announced calls for tenders for various broadcasting frequencies , including band CARDINAL .

The applicant company and CARDINAL other companies , GPE and ORG , submitted bids for band CARDINAL . The applicant company alleged that GPE had never previously operated in the field of television broadcasting and its main focus had been as the organiser of entertainment shows for young people and students . None of its employees had a background in professional journalism and the company had no premises , equipment and financial or technical infrastructure to commence broadcasting at the time of its bid . It further alleged that ORG had been registered DATE before the tender process took place and had had no previous experience of any sort in the field of broadcasting .

On DATE , before the winners of the tender process were announced , the applicant company instituted proceedings against the ORG before ORG ( ՀՀ տնտեսական դատարան ) . In its application to the court , the applicant company argued that the ORG had unlawfully postponed the call for tenders for band CARDINAL , that the ORG had violated the law and restricted the applicant company 's opportunities by announcing separate calls for tenders for different bands as opposed to a single one for all bands and that the ORG had exceeded its authority when defining the terms and conditions of the tendering procedure .
On DATE the ORG held a points - based vote and recognised GPE as the winner of the call for tenders for band CARDINAL . The decision stated :

“ Based on sections DATE and CARDINAL of [ LAW ] , sections CARDINAL , DATE and DATE of [ the NTRC ] Regulations Act and LAW no . CARDINAL of [ the ORG ] of DATE Approving ORG and ORG , and taking into account the results of the call for tenders for television broadcasting on decimetric band CARDINAL in the area of GPE , [ the ORG ] decides ( CARDINAL ) to recognise GPE as the winner of the call for tenders for television broadcasting on decimetric band CARDINAL in the area of GPE , and ( CARDINAL ) to grant a television broadcasting license to GPE ”

On DATE the applicant company lodged an additional application with ORG seeking , inter alia , to annul the decision of DATE . The applicant company also alleged that it had unsuccessfully requested the court to oblige the ORG to present TIME of their meeting which provided basis for this decision .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant company 's applications . The court found that , even though the ORG should have announced the call for tenders DATE prior to the expiration of the applicant company 's license , this had not been done as certain legal acts , which were necessary for the proper conduct of the tender process , had not been adopted by that time . The court further found that the fact that the ORG had announced separate calls for tenders instead of a single one did not contradict the law . The applicant company had not been precluded from submitting bids for all these calls for tenders . The court finally stated that the ORG had been authorised under the law to define the terms and conditions of the tendering procedure and it had not exceeded its authority in doing so .

The applicant company lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) . In its appeal , the applicant company raised the same arguments as before ORG , claiming that the latter had not interpreted the law correctly . It further complained about the court 's rejection of its request concerning TIME ORG 's meeting .
On DATE ORG adopted a decision on the applicant company 's appealinter alia , that :

“ ... the arguments put forward in the appeal concerning a violation by ORG of [ the relevant legal acts ] are groundless , as [ the ORG ] , acting within the authority vested in it by the above legal acts ... defined the tendering rules for licensing of television broadcasting , which contains the rules on the conditions , procedures and time - limits of a call for tenders , submission of bids , recognising the winner of a call for tenders and declaring a call for tenders void . On DATE [ the ORG ] ... announced separate calls for tenders for unoccupied frequencies and on DATE in its decision no . CARDINAL recognised the winner of the call for tenders .

The applicant 's representative submitted a motion in court requesting that ' [ the ORG ] present the minutes of decision no . CARDINAL ' . [ ORG ] , stating that the dispute concerned the lawfulness of [ ORG 's ] decision no . CARDINAL and not the decision 's TIME , justly dismissed this motion .
... a well - founded dismissal of a motion which is not relevant for the resolution of the dispute has nothing to do with ... the requirements of LAW ] .
... the judgment of the ORG ”

On DATE as the announcement of the license winner , the ORG issued a memorandum to ORG ( ՀՀ տրանսպորտի և կապի նախարարություն ) requesting it to terminate broadcasts by the ACARDINAL + television channel .

On DATE , at CARDINALhCARDINAL , ORG of ORG - owned ORG ( ORG ցանց DATE “ the TNA ” ) , with whom the applicant company had earlier entered into a lease agreement to temporarily rent industrial LOC for the purpose of installing transmitter equipment , cut the electricity supply of the applicant company 's transmitter and the ACARDINAL + television channel ceased to broadcast .
The applicant company contested the actions of the ORG before ORG claiming that they had been unlawful and in violation of the lease agreement .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant company 's claim , finding that the actions of the ORG had been lawful and that the applicant company should have ceased broadcasting voluntarily as it was no longer licensed .
The applicant company lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant company 's appeal as unsubstantiated .
On DATE the ORG announced a new call for tenders for CARDINAL other bands .
The applicant company submitted bids for CARDINAL of the CARDINAL bands , namely bands CARDINAL , DATE and DATE .
On DATE the ORG announced another call for tenders for band CARDINAL .
The applicant company submitted its bid .
On DATE the ORG recognised the winner of the call for tenders for band CARDINAL . The applicant company was again refused a license .
On DATE the ORG recognised the winners of the call for tenders for bands CARDINAL , DATE and DATE . The applicant company was again refused a license .
On an unspecified date , the ORG announced a call for tenders for bands CARDINAL and DATE .
The applicant company submitted bids for both bands .
On DATE the ORG recognised the winners of the call for tenders . The applicant company was again refused a license .
On DATE the ORG announced a call for tenders for the last vacant band , namely band CARDINAL .
The applicant company submitted its bid .
On DATE the ORG recognised the winner of the call for tenders . The applicant company was again refused a license .
The relevant provisions of the LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :

“ Unlawful acts of public authorities , local self - government bodies and their officials can be annulled or their actions ( inaction ) can be contested ( hereafter , annulling the unlawful act ) if the act in question contradicts the law and if there is evidence that the applicant 's rights and ( or ) freedoms guaranteed by LAW and laws have been violated . ”

“ An appeal on points of law can be lodged on : ( CARDINAL ) the ground of a material or a procedural violation of the parties ' rights ; [ and ] ( CARDINAL ) the ground of newly discovered circumstances . ”
“ Having examined a case , ORG has the right :
( CARDINAL ) to uphold the court judgment and to dismiss the appeal ... ;
( CARDINAL ) to quash the whole or part of the judgment and to remit the case for a new examination ... ;
( CARDINAL ) to terminate the proceedings or to leave the claim unexamined , if the grounds for [ doing so ] were disclosed during the proceedings in the court of first instance , ORG or ORG . ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG is not entitled to establish or consider as proven circumstances which have not been established by the judgment [ of ORG ] or have been rejected by it , to determine whether or not this or that piece of evidence is trustworthy , to resolve the issue as to which piece of evidence has more weight or the issue as to which norm of substantive law must be applied and what kind of judgment must be adopted upon the new examination of the case . ”
The relevant provisions of LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
“ In GPE television and radio broadcasting shall be conducted on the basis of a licence . ”

“ ORG ( hereafter , ORG ) is an independent body with the status of a public agency whose activity is regulated by this law , its regulations and the legislation of GPE . ORG deals with licensing and monitoring of only private television and radio companies ( television companies or radio companies ) .

ORG : ( a ) shall allocate broadcasting frequencies on a public and competitive basis and ensure the publication of complete information on the results of a call for tenders ; ... ( c ) shall grant licences ... ”
“ The National Commission shall have CARDINAL members appointed by the President of GPE for a term of DATE , with the exception of the first composition ... ”
“ A television and radio broadcasting licence shall be granted for a particular available frequency on the basis of a call for tenders ... ”
“ When selecting the licence - holder , the ORG shall take into account :
( a ) the predominance of programmes produced in - house ;
( b ) the predominance of programmes produced in GPE ;
( c ) the technical and financial capacity of the applicant ; and
( d ) the professional level of the staff . ”
“ A licence shall not be granted if :
( a ) the applicant can not be a licence - holder pursuant to this law ;
( b ) the information contained in the bid is inaccurate ; or
( c ) the technical capacity for television and radio broadcasting is lacking or the declared technical capacity is insufficient .
An applicant shall be informed in writing of the reasons for the refusal of a licence within DATE from the date of the decision .
The refusal of a licence can be contested before the courts . ”

A licence to broadcast television and radio programmes or to produce and broadcast [ such programmes ] shall be granted to television and radio companies : ( a ) ... ; ( b ) for a period of DATE for on - air television and radio broadcasting . ”
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :

“ In order to grant a broadcasting licence , the ORG , at its meeting and within the period prescribed by the tendering rules , shall adopt a decision on the basis of the results of a call for tenders . ”
“ Following the consideration of a bid , the Commission shall adopt one of the following decisions : ( a ) to grant a licence ; or ( b ) to refuse a licence . ”
“ A copy of the decision granting or refusing a licence shall be duly sent to the applicant within DATE from its adoption . ”
